H0.text: Winter is the season that occurs when the Northern Hemisphere is tilted away from the Sun, causing the rays of light to hit Earth at large angles.

H1.text: Spring occurs when the Northern Hemisphere is tilted away from the Sun, causing the sunâ€™s rays to hit Earth at large angles.

H2.text: Summer is the season that occurs when the Northern Hemisphere is tilted away from the Sun, causing the rays of light to hit Earth at large angles.

H3.text: Fall occurs when the Northern Hemisphere is tilted away from the Sun, causing the rays of light to hit Earth at large angles.

A4.text: the low angle of the Sun during the winter months means that incoming rays of solar radiation are spread over a larger area of the Earth's surface, so the light received is more indirect and of lower intensity

A5.text: the Northern Hemisphere will be experiencing spring as the hours of daylight increase
